out_data:
Marie Canyon Green Streets
Marie Canyon Green Streets,Capital Improvement Projects (Design),Capital Improvement Projects (Design). 
Marie Canyon Green Streets
(cid:190) Updates:(cid:131) The City has recently received Measure W funds to complete this
project. Staff is working on the project plans to prepare for public
bidding.(cid:190) Project Schedule:(cid:131) Complete Design: May 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Winter 2021

PCH Median Improvements Project
PCH Median Improvements Project,Capital Improvement Projects (Design),Capital Improvement Projects (Design). 
PCH Median Improvements Project(cid:190) Updates:(cid:131) Consultant is working on the final design. In March, the City be seeking
proposals from consultants to perform construction management.(cid:190) Project Schedule:(cid:131) Complete Design: Spring 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Fall 2021Page 1 of 6Agenda Item # 4.A.

PCH Signal Synchronization System Improvements Project
PCH Signal Synchronization System Improvements Project,Capital Improvement Projects (Design),Capital Improvement Projects (Design). 

PCH Signal Synchronization System Improvements Project(cid:190) Updates:(cid:131) 65% design package was submitted to Caltrans in November 2020 andwe are still awaiting comments to those plans.
(cid:131) Consultant is working on final design documents.(cid:190) Project Schedule:(cid:131) Complete Final Design: May 2021
(cid:131) Advertise: July 2021
(cid:131) Award Contract and Begin Construction: September 2021

Civic Center Stormwater Diversion Structure
Civic Center Stormwater Diversion Structure,Capital Improvement Projects (Design),Capital Improvement Projects (Design). 
Civic Center Stormwater Diversion Structure(cid:190) Updates:(cid:131) A Los Angeles County Flood Control maintenance agreement is
required for this project. Staff is waiting for the County’s approval of
the agreement.(cid:190) Project Schedule:(cid:131) Final Design: Completed. Awaiting approved maintenance agreementfrom the County.(cid:131) Begin Construction: Estimated Summer 2021

Westward Beach Road Improvements Project
Westward Beach Road Improvements Project,Capital Improvement Projects (Design),Capital Improvement Projects (Design). 
Westward Beach Road Improvements Project(cid:190) Updates:(cid:131) The project requires coordination with Los Angeles County Beaches
and Harbor. Staff is working out the final details of the project with the
County and will be finalizing the design.(cid:190) Project Schedule:(cid:131) Complete Design: Spring 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Fall 2021

Civic Center Water Treatment Facility Phase 2
Civic Center Water Treatment Facility Phase 2,Capital Improvement Projects (Design),Capital Improvement Projects (Design). 
Civic Center Water Treatment Facility Phase 2(cid:190) Updates:(cid:131) Project is at the 65% design phase.
(cid:131) The City obtained a project CDP from Planning Commission onFebruary 1, 2021.(cid:131) The State is reviewing the City’s application for the State RevolvingFund program.(cid:131) The project assessment engineer has begun the process of evaluatingthe project costs.(cid:131) Staff is rescheduling the community meeting to May 2021.(cid:190) Project Schedule:(cid:131) Complete Design: December 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: March 2022Page 2 of 6Agenda Item # 4.A.

Malibu Park Drainage Improvements
Malibu Park Drainage Improvements,Capital Improvement Projects (Design),Capital Improvement Projects (Design). 
Malibu Park Drainage Improvements(cid:190) Updates:(cid:131) Staff made minor modifications to the project plans to reduce theoverall project costs.(cid:131) Project is out to bid with bids due April 21, 2021.(cid:190) Project Schedule:(cid:131) Complete Design: March 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: June/July 2021

Annual Street Maintenance
Annual Street Maintenance,Capital Improvement Projects (Design),Capital Improvement Projects (Design). 
Annual Street Maintenance(cid:190) Project Description: This project provides for the reconstruction andmaintenance of City streets.(cid:190) Estimated Schedule:(cid:131) Complete Design: Spring 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Summer 2021Capital Improvement Projects (Construction)

City Hall Roof Replacement
City Hall Roof Replacement,Capital Improvement Projects (Construction),Capital Improvement Projects (Construction). 
City Hall Roof Replacement(cid:190) Updates: City staff continues to review project related material submittals.
Once submittals are approved, all materials will be ordered and shipped to
the project site. The roof ISO board membrane is on back order due to the
recent storms in Texas which halted manufacturing. The estimated material
arrival and start date is the middle of May.
(cid:190) Project Schedule: May 2021 through July 2021

Bluffs Park Workout Station
Bluffs Park Workout Station,Capital Improvement Projects (Construction),Capital Improvement Projects (Construction). 
Bluffs Park Workout Station(cid:190) Updates: The contractor has completed and installed all the new workout
equipment and rubber surfacing. Remaining work includes punch list items
only.(cid:190) Project Schedule: Estimated completion date is April 2021.

Civic Center Way Improvements
Civic Center Way Improvements,Capital Improvement Projects (Construction),Capital Improvement Projects (Construction). 
Civic Center Way Improvements(cid:190) Updates:(cid:131) Work Hours: Monday through Friday 7:00AM to 4:00PM, Saturdays7:00AM to 4:00PM(cid:131) Civic Center Way was reopened to the public on April 8th. While being
open, many project related items will continue. This will include
intermittent traffic control (lane closures). The remaining items includes
final paving, striping, irrigation, painting, planting material, clean-up,
and final detailing.(cid:190) Project Schedule: August 2020 through April 2021Page 3 of 6Agenda Item # 4.A.
Capital Improvement Projects (Not Started)

Bluffs Park Shade Structure
Bluffs Park Shade Structure,Capital Improvement Projects (Not Started),Capital Improvement Projects (Not Started). 
Bluffs Park Shade Structure(cid:190) Project Description: This project consists of the installation of four single-postshade structures at Malibu Bluffs Park(cid:190) Estimated Schedule:(cid:131) Complete Design: Summer 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Fall 2021

Vehicle Protection Devices
Vehicle Protection Devices,Capital Improvement Projects (Not Started),Capital Improvement Projects (Not Started). 
Vehicle Protection Devices(cid:190) Project Description: Per Malibu Municipal Code Section 17.48.070 requires
vehicle impact protection devices to be installed for all parking spaces located
adjacent to any outdoor pedestrian seating area. There are two locations
within the City’s right-of-way and City-owned property that would require a
vehicle impact protection device.(cid:190) Estimated Schedule:(cid:131) Complete Design: Summer 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Fall 2021

Malibu Road Slope Repairs
Malibu Road Slope Repairs,Capital Improvement Projects (Not Started),Capital Improvement Projects (Not Started). 
Malibu Road Slope Repairs(cid:190) Project Description: The existing slope adjacent to the beach access stairs
at 24712 Malibu Road has been eroded and caused damage to Malibu Road.(cid:190) Estimated Schedule:(cid:131) Complete Design: Fall 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Winter 2021Disaster Projects (Design)

Trancas Canyon Park Planting and Irrigation Repairs (CalJPIA/FEMA Project)
Trancas Canyon Park Planting and Irrigation Repairs (CalJPIA/FEMA Project),Disaster Projects (Design),Disaster Projects (Design). 
Trancas Canyon Park Planting and Irrigation Repairs (CalJPIA/FEMA Project)(cid:190) Updates:(cid:131) The project consultant has started the design of this project.(cid:190) Project Schedule:(cid:131) Complete Design: Summer 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Summer/Fall 2021

Outdoor Warning Sirens (FEMA Project)
Outdoor Warning Sirens (FEMA Project),Disaster Projects (Design),Disaster Projects (Design). 
Outdoor Warning Sirens (FEMA Project)(cid:190) Updates: This project will be funded through a grant from FEMA after the
Wooley Fire. The project consists of hiring a consultant to develop a plan that
includes the evaluation of a siren system and possible locations. Staff is
working on an RFQ to hire a consultant for the design.(cid:190) Project Schedule:(cid:131) Complete Design: Unknown

Clover Heights Storm Drain (FEMA Project)
Clover Heights Storm Drain (FEMA Project),Disaster Projects (Not Started),Disaster Projects (Not Started). 

Disaster Projects (Not Started)
Clover Heights Storm Drain (FEMA Project)(cid:190) Project Description: This project consists of design and construction of a few
storm drains on Clover Heights. The existing storm drain facility ends at the
intersection of Clover Heights and Harvester Road. During storms, this
intersection floods and causes debris to block the road. An extended storm
drain towards the end of Clover Heights will help eliminate this issue.(cid:190) Estimated Schedule:(cid:131) Complete Design: Spring 2022
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Summer 2022

Storm Drain Master Plan (FEMA Project)
Storm Drain Master Plan (FEMA Project),Disaster Projects (Not Started),Disaster Projects (Not Started). 
Storm Drain Master Plan (FEMA Project)(cid:190) Project Description: This project will be funded through a grant from FEMA
after the Woolsey Fire. The City will create a complete inventory of storm
drains, culverts, debris basins, manholes, and other drainage structures
within the City.(cid:190) Estimated Schedule:(cid:131) Completion Date: Spring 2022Page 6 of 6Agenda Item # 4.A.
